title: GAD-7 Anxiety Assessment
introduction: The GAD-7 is a validated anxiety screening tool consisting of 7 questions that can help identify the severity of anxiety symptoms.
purpose: This scale is designed to help identify and assess anxiety symptoms, but it cannot replace professional medical diagnosis.
instructions: Over the last 2 weeks, how often have you been bothered by the following problems?
disclaimer: This assessment is for screening purposes only and does not replace professional medical advice.

gad7-1.text: Feeling nervous, anxious, or on edge

gad7-2.text: Not being able to stop or control worrying

gad7-3.text: Worrying too much about different things

gad7-5.text: Being so restless that it's hard to sit still

gad7-7.text: Feeling afraid, as if something awful might happen

minimal.interpretation: Your score indicates that you currently have no significant anxiety symptoms.
minimal.recommendations: Continue to maintain a healthy lifestyle, including regular sleep, balanced diet, and moderate exercise.
minimal.supportResources: If you experience stress, consider learning stress management techniques.

mild.interpretation: Your score suggests you may have mild anxiety symptoms.
mild.recommendations: Consider monitoring your anxiety levels and learning stress management techniques.
mild.supportResources: Consider mindfulness apps, relaxation techniques, or support groups.

moderate.interpretation: Your score suggests you may have moderate anxiety symptoms.
moderate.recommendations: We recommend seeking professional help, including counseling or psychiatric evaluation.
moderate.supportResources: Please consider contacting a mental health professional who can provide appropriate treatment recommendations.

severe.interpretation: Your score suggests you may have severe anxiety symptoms.
severe.recommendations: We recommend seeking professional help immediately, which may include a combination of medication and psychotherapy.
severe.supportResources: Please contact a mental health professional soon who can develop a personalized treatment plan for you.
